intro: Fabiana stephanii, commonly known as the silverleaf fabiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a container plant. Fabiana stephanii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
